intro: Euphrasia alpigena, commonly known as the alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Euphrasia alpigena is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
